Complete as many reps as possible in 12 minutes of:

1 strict pull-up, 2 push-ups, 3 squats
2 strict pull-ups, 4 push-ups, 6 squats
3 strict pull-ups, 6 push-ups, 9 squats
Etc.
Start at a higher round if you think it will allow you to complete more reps in the 12 minutes—e.g., 5-10-15, then 6-12-18, then 7-14-21, etc.,
Post starting point, finishing point and total reps completed to comments.

Complete as many rounds as possible in 12 minutes of:
1 squat snatch
3 clean and jerks
30 double-unders

Scroll for scaling options.
Post rounds completed to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• Chad Vaughn, 285-lb. Snatch
• Chad Vaughn, 315-lb. Clean and Jerk

p.br: Select a middling but manageable load for the barbell, knowing that the snatch will be the limiting factor for almost all athletes. Avoid misses on the snatch and perform touch-and-go clean and jerks if you’re able to. Modify the rope work so you can get back to the barbell in about a minute or less.

Complete as many rounds as possible in 12 minutes of:
1 squat snatch
3 clean and jerks
30 double-unders

hr.p:
Men: 125 lb.
Women: 85 lb.

p.br:
Complete as many rounds as possible in 12 minutes of:
1 squat snatch
3 clean and jerks
30 single-unders

hr.p:
Men: 95 lb.
Women: 65 lb.

div.p:
On a 12-minute clock:
1 minute of GHD sit-ups
1 minute of bar muscle-ups
2 minutes of GHD sit-ups
2 minutes of bar muscle-ups
3 minutes of GHD sit-ups
3 minutes of bar muscle-ups

Scroll for scaling options.
Post reps for each exercise completed to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The GHD Sit-Up
• The Bar Muscle-Up

p.br: You have a total of 6 minutes to perform each movement, and the volume will demand rest breaks—especially in intervals 4-6. Select modifications that force you to work relatively hard for each rep of the pulling movement, and modify the core work so you do not have to take long rest breaks. The GHD sit-up is potent: Avoid large increases in volume over previous workouts or sub out for sit-ups.

On a 12-minute clock:
1 minute of GHD sit-ups to parallel
1 minute of chest-to-bar pull-ups
2 minutes of GHD sit-ups to parallel
2 minutes of chest-to-bar pull-ups
3 minutes of GHD sit-ups to parallel
3 minutes of chest-to-bar pull-ups

On a 12-minute clock:
1 minute of AbMat sit-ups
1 minute of assisted chest-to-bar pull-ups
2 minutes of AbMat sit-ups
2 minutes of assisted chest-to-bar pull-ups
3 minutes of AbMat sit-ups
3 minutes of assisted chest-to-bar pull-ups

div.p:
Complete as many rounds as possible in 20 minutes of:
5 thrusters
7 hang power cleans
10 sumo deadlift high pulls

Scroll for scaling options.
Post rounds completed to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The Thruster
• The Hang Power Clean
• The Sumo Deadlift High Pull

p.br: Loads should be light to allow a large number of reps in 20 minutes. Ideally, each set of 5, 7 and 10 reps is performed unbroken, at least for the first half to two-thirds of the workout.

Complete as many rounds as possible in 20 minutes of:
5 thrusters
7 hang power cleans
10 sumo deadlift high pulls

hr.p:
Men: 65 lb.
Women: 45 lb.

p.br:
Complete as many rounds as possible in 20 minutes of:
5 thrusters
7 hang power cleans
10 sumo deadlift high pulls

hr.p:
Men: 45 lb.
Women: 35 lb.

div.p:
Tabata handstand push-ups
Rest 1 minute
Tabata single-leg squats
Rest 1 minute
Tabata push-ups
Rest 1 minute
Tabata jumping lunges
The Tabata interval is 20 seconds of work followed by 10 seconds of rest for 8 intervals.

Scroll for scaling options.
Post reps for each exercise completed to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• Tabata Interval Training
• Scaling the Pistol

p.br: You’re alternating between upper-body and lower-body movements, but expect the push-ups and lunges to be affected by the previous work. Use modifications that allow you to complete no fewer than 4-6 reps for the first two Tabatas, and target at least 6-8 reps in the last two Tabatas.

Tabata assisted handstand push-ups
Rest 1 minute
Tabata assisted single-leg squats
Rest 1 minute
Tabata push-ups
Rest 1 minute
Tabata jumping lunges

Tabata push-ups
Rest 1 minute
Tabata squats Rest 1 minute
Tabata knee push-ups
Rest 1 minute
Tabata walking lunges

div.p:
50-40-30-20-10 reps for time of:
Double-unders
Sit-ups

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• Chris Spealler Does "Annie"
• WOD Demo 100813 With Dave Castro
• "Annie" With CrossFit New England Kids

p.br: Annie is meant to be performed at high speed, with the sit-ups as the limiting factor. Modify the double-unders so you can mow down the rope work, and reduce the sit-up reps so each round is challenging but manageable.

35-25-15-10-5 reps for time of:
Single-unders
Sit-ups

div.p:
4 rounds for time of:
Run 400 meters
50 squats

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The Air Squat
• Squat Therapy

p.br: You should be moving almost continuously in this workout. Reduce the run distance so you can go right into the squats, and reduce the number of squats so you can start running right after the last rep is complete.

3 rounds for time of:
Jog 400 meters
30 squats

hr.p: "Top Cancer Doctor Resigns as Editor of Medical Journal," The New York Times.
Post thoughts to comments.

div.p:
10 rounds on the C2 rower of:
Pull a sub-1:25/500-m pace for as long as possible
Rest 3 minutes
Scale pace as needed so that first interval can be maintained for approximately 1 minute.

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time maintained for each interval to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• Rowing

p.br: The goal is to pull a fast pace and and generate high power output for a short period, with a moderate amount of rest to follow. Adjust the target pace so you have to work to stay under that number, and aim for intervals of at least 30-40 seconds in the later rounds.

10 rounds on the C2 rower of:
Pull a sub-1:45/500-m pace for as long as possible
Rest 3 minutes

5 rounds on the C2 rower of:
Pull a sub-2:00/500-m pace for as long as possible
Rest 3 minutes

div.p:
For time:
15 burpees, jumping over the barbell
5 clean and jerks
12 burpees, jumping over the barbell
4 clean and jerks
9 burpees, jumping over the barbell
3 clean and jerks

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The Power Clean and Push Jerk

p.br: The 12 clean and jerks in this workout should be relatively heavy but not a series of max-effort singles. Choose a load that’s challenging but doesn’t require significant amounts of rest after every rep.

For time:
15 burpees, jumping over the barbell
5 clean and jerks
12 burpees, jumping over the barbell
4 clean and jerks
9 burpees, jumping over the barbell
3 clean and jerks

hr.p:
Men: 185 lb.
Women: 135 lb.

p.br:
For time:

5 clean and jerks
12 burpees, jumping over the barbell
4 clean and jerks
9 burpees, jumping over the barbell

Women: 95 lb.

div.p:
Complete as many rounds as possible in 12 minutes of:
3 rope climbs, 15-ft. rope
20 box jumps

Scroll for scaling options.
Post rounds completed to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The J-Hook Rope Climb
• The Box Jump

p.br: Today’s WOD allows only 12 minutes of work, so try to avoid spending more than 60-90 seconds on each set of rope climbs. Select modifications that get you back to the box on time, and reduce the height of the box so you can perform the reps without large breaks.

Complete as many rounds as possible in 12 minutes of:
3 rope climbs, 15-ft. rope
20 box jumps

hr.p:
Men: 24-in. box
Women: 20-in. box

p.br:
Complete as many rounds as possible in 12 minutes of:
3 rope climbs, lying to standing
20 box jumps

hr.p:
Men: 20-in. box
Women: 16-in. box
"How CrossFit can lead to a healthier mind, body, and soul," Fox 2 Detroit.
Post thoughts to comments.

div.p:
5 rounds for time of:
400-m run
15 thrusters
10 burpees

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The Thruster
• The Burpee

p.br: Nothing should slow you down in this workout. The run distance is short, the reps are relatively low, and the loading is light. Modify each element so you can attack it with intensity in each round and quickly move on to the next element.

5 rounds for time of:
400-m run
15 thrusters
10 burpees

hr.p:
Men: 55 lb.
Women: 35 lb.

p.br:
3 rounds for time of:
400-m run
10 thrusters
7 burpees

hr.p:
Men: 45 lb.
Women: 22 lb.

div.p:
Scroll for scaling options.
Post loads to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• Chad Vaughn, 315-lb. Clean and Jerk

p.br: Pick loads that allow you to attempt to set a PR in the later sets. If you are not comfortable with heavy clean and jerks, add a few reps to the early sets so you can drill mechanics. If mechanics remain sound, try to to lift loads that are relatively heavy for you in the final sets.
Clean and jerk 3-3-2-2-2-1-1 reps

div.p:
5 rounds for time of:
400-m run
10 overhead squats

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The Overhead Squat

p.br: A variation on the benchmark Nancy, this WOD uses heavier loads and fewer reps to deliver almost the same amount of volume as the classic Girl Workout. Even with heavier barbells, this is a conditioning workout, not a strength test. Reduce the load so you can perform an appropriate number of relatively heavy overhead squats unbroken or in no more than 2 sets.

5 rounds for time of:
400-m run
10 overhead squats

hr.p:
Men: 95 lb.
Women: 65 lb.

p.br:
4 rounds for time of:
400-m jog
7 overhead squats

hr.p:
Men: 65 lb.
Women: 35 lb.
"CrossFit is amassing an army of doctors trying to disrupt health care" Vox.
Post thoughts to comments.

50 jumping pull-ups
50 kettlebell swings
50 walking-lunge steps
50 knees-to-elbows

Men: 24-inch box, 16-kg KB, 45-lb. push press, 20-lb. ball
Women: 20-inch box, 12-kg KB, 35-lb. push press, 14-lb. ball

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• WOD 120111 Demo with CFNE Filthy Fifty

p.br: A classic chipper of 500 reps, this longer workout is characterized by intermediate-level body-weight movements and light loads that allow people to keep moving with limited rest. Newer athletes should reduce the volume and use movement modifications that ensure large sets and short rest breaks.

For time:
50 box jumps
50 jumping pull-ups
50 kettlebell swings
50 walking-lunge steps
50 knees-to-elbows
50 push presses
50 back extensions
50 wall-ball shots
50 burpees
50 double-unders

hr.p:
Men: 20-inch box, 12-kg KB, 33-lb. push press, 14-lb. ball
Women: 16-inch box, 8-kg KB, 22-lb. push press, 10-lb. ball

For time:
30 box jumps
30 jumping pull-ups
30 kettlebell swings
30 walking-lunge steps
30 hanging leg raises
30 push presses
30 back extensions
30 wall-ball shots
30 burpees
30 single-unders

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• Rowing
• The Thruster
• The Kipping Pull-Up

p.br: The benchmark Jackie is meant to be performed at very high intensity. Reduce the distance of the row and the weight of the bar to ensure you can push the pace. Modify the pull-ups so you can crank out large sets that test your conditioning.

For time:
1,000-meter row
50 thrusters
30 pull-ups

hr.p:
Men: 35 lb.
Women: 22 lb.

p.br:
For time:
800-meter row
35 thrusters
20 assisted pull-ups

hr.p:
Men: 22 lb.
Women: 12 lb.

div.p:
Scroll for scaling options.
Post loads to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• Simplifying the Deadlift With Coach Glassman
• The Deadlift

p.br: Athletes of all levels can perform this deadlift workout designed to test strength endurance in 10-rep sets followed by adequate recovery. Ideally, each set will be as heavy as possible for 10 reps, but newer athletes should start light and add weight as they are comfortable. For those athletes, the early sets can be used to drill mechanics as they build toward heavier final sets that challenge strength.

hr.p: "Exercise Wins: Fit Seniors Can Have Hearts That Look 30 Years Younger," NPR.
Post thoughts to comments.

div.p:
50-40-30-20-10 reps for time of:
Medicine-ball cleans
Box jumps

Men: 20-lb. ball, 24-in. box
Women: 14-lb. ball, 20-in. box

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The Medicine-Ball Clean
• Read: Medicine-Ball Cleans

p.br: This couplet contains a significant number of reps but is designed so athletes can keep moving at a steady pace. Select modifications and loads that encourage large sets and short rest breaks. Strive for virtuosity in the medicine-ball clean.

40-30-20-10-5 reps for time of:
Medicine-ball cleans
Box jumps

Women: 10-lb. ball, 15-in. box

Box jumps

Scroll for scaling options.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The Split Jerk
• Footwork in the Split With Chad Vaughn

p.br: All athletes can attempt split-jerk triples. Newer athletes should spend plenty of time drilling the movement before adding weight.

div.p:
3 rounds for time of:
30 dumbbell snatches
30 toes-to-bars

Scroll for scaling options.
Post time to comments.

hr.p:
Related content:
• The Dumbbell Snatch
• The Kipping Toes-to-Bar

p.br: The dumbbell work is meant to be fast and should not slow you down. Choose lighter loads to keep the intensity high, and select toes-to-bars modifications that allow you to complete the reps in about 4-5 sets. Avoid laboring for singles or very small sets.

3 rounds for time of:
30 dumbbell snatches
30 hanging leg raises

hr.p:
Men: 35-lb. dumbbell
Women: 20-lb. dumbbell

p.br:
3 rounds for time of:
30 dumbbell snatches
30 hanging knee raises

hr.p:
Men: 20-lb. dumbbell
Women: 15-lb. dumbbell
